Subject: Re: Rebuilding t=
he minions!


  
>
> Lamia smiled when she heard those words

Marauder flew=
 in, his massive wings cupping the superheated thermal
updrafts as they fle=
w towards the island in the distance. They flew
towards the single large vo=
lcano that dominanted the island. The skies
here were choked with smoke and=
 ash, while the grounds, nearly bereft
of vegatation, were burnt and ruined=
, only brown whisps of life were
able to hang on tenaciously in this barren=
 rocky landscape, blown
about by hot winds. In several places large gouts o=
f obsidan like
stone rose from the ground as if thrust through the ground b=
y the
violent shaking from beneath. They resmbled the claws and bones of
so=
me terrifyingly huge mishappen beast.

It was over this that marauder flew,=
 carrying Lamia. He finally came
to rest near the top of the volcano, on a =
lonely ledge. Setting her
down he shifted into his robot mode.

He smiled a=
t her as he gestured at the vista of destruction that was
around them, "Wel=
come home Lamia." he said, his voice dark and cold.
"This is only the begin=
ing."

Behind them a previously hidden door in the cliff face itself opened=

revealing only darkness inside. Red lights slowly came on, looking
like bu=
rning embers that lit the interior, revelaing a large hall that
led further=
 into the mountain itself.

"Come." Marauder said, "we have much to do."

(=
TAG)

Preston
